security_audit.summary: This skill is a quality analysis tool with security scanning capabilities. All static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The scripts contain regex patterns to DETECT security vulnerabilities in other code - they do not execute dangerous operations. The skill only requires Read, Grep, and Glob permissions.

content.user_title: Analyze and improve Claude response quality
content.value_statement: Sometimes Claude's responses miss requirements, lack error handling, or have security issues. This skill provides systematic quality evaluation with scoring, gap analysis, and improvement recommendations.
actual_capabilities: Evaluates responses across six quality dimensions: correctness, completeness, clarity, efficiency, security, and usability
Scores code quality using AST analysis for Python and pattern analysis for JavaScript
Detects missing error handling, input validation, and edge case coverage
Identifies security vulnerabilities including SQL injection, XSS, and hardcoded secrets
Generates structured quality reports with prioritized recommendations
Compares response coverage against original requirements
limitations: Validation scripts are planned but not yet fully implemented - provides manual guidelines
Limited to Read, Grep, and Glob tools - cannot execute code to verify functionality
Python AST analysis more thorough than JavaScript pattern-based checks
Requires manual judgment for complex architectural or design quality issues

use_cases.title: Review code implementations
use_cases.description: After Claude generates code, invoke this skill to check for security issues, missing error handling, and best practice violations.

use_cases.title: Validate response completeness
use_cases.description: Verify that Claude's responses address all stated requirements before accepting the output for production use.

use_cases.title: Security audit AI-generated code
use_cases.description: Scan Claude's code output for OWASP vulnerabilities, hardcoded credentials, and insecure patterns before deployment.

prompt_templates.title: Quick quality check
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the quality of my last response. Score it on correctness, completeness, and clarity.

prompt_templates.title: Code security review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for security vulnerabilities. Check for injection risks, hardcoded secrets, and insecure functions.

prompt_templates.title: Completeness analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare my response against the original requirements. List any missing functionality, unhandled edge cases, or gaps in documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Full quality report
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete quality analysis report. Score all six dimensions, identify critical and important issues, and provide prioritized recommendations.

output_examples.input: Analyze the quality of my authentication code
output: Critical: SQL injection vulnerability found on line 45 - use parameterized queries
Critical: Passwords stored with MD5 - upgrade to bcrypt
Important: No rate limiting on login attempts
Missing: Password reset functionality not implemented

output_examples.input: Check if my response addressed all requirements
output: Addressed: User authentication, session management, logout
Missing: Password reset flow, remember-me functionality
Gap: Error handling not present for database failures
Suggestion: Add input validation for email format

best_practices: Run quality analysis after completing complex multi-step tasks to catch omissions before finalizing
Use the security checker on all code that handles user input, authentication, or sensitive data
Review the quality scores and address critical issues before moving to important ones
anti_patterns: Skipping quality analysis on small code changes - even minor changes can introduce security issues
Ignoring completeness checks when under time pressure - missing requirements cause rework
Running only code quality checks without security analysis - functionality and security are both essential

faq.question: When should I use this skill?
faq.answer: Use after completing complex tasks, large code implementations, or when uncertain about response quality. It auto-invokes during self-reflection.

faq.question: What quality dimensions does it evaluate?
faq.answer: Correctness, completeness, clarity, efficiency, security, and usability. Each is scored 1-5 with specific criteria.

faq.question: Can it automatically fix issues it finds?
faq.answer: No, it identifies and prioritizes issues with recommendations. You must implement the fixes manually based on the analysis.

faq.question: Does the security checker catch all vulnerabilities?
faq.answer: It catches common OWASP patterns like injection, XSS, and hardcoded secrets. Complex logic vulnerabilities require manual review.

faq.question: What languages does the code quality checker support?
faq.answer: Python with full AST analysis and JavaScript with pattern-based checks. Other languages get basic metrics only.

faq.question: Are the validation scripts ready to use?
faq.answer: The scripts exist but are marked as planned features. Currently, the skill provides manual guidelines and checklists for quality analysis.
